Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujibur Rahman is the founding president and the Father of the Nation of Bangladesh. He struggled lifelong for the freedom and rights of the Bengalis. He was assassinated with his family on August 15, 1975.

Dhaka is the capital of Bangladesh. It is a busy city and the largest metropolis in the country. The main industries of Bangladesh are garments and agriculture. Jute is an important cash crop of Bangladesh.

Bangladesh's national flower is Shapla (Water Lily), the national fruit is Jackfruit, the national bird is Doel (Magpie-Robin), and the national animal is the Royal Bengal Tiger. The climate of Bangladesh is generally warm and humid. There are six seasons here.
